benchmark_details.name: Dataset- and Task-Independent Recommender System (DTIRS)
benchmark_details.overview: The Dataset- and Task-Independent Recommender System (DTIRS) framework aims to maximize the reusability of recommender systems by eliminating the need for extensive dataset- and task-specific configurations. It uses the Dataset Description Language (DsDL) to provide standardized dataset descriptions and task definitions, allowing automated feature engineering, model selection, and optimization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To introduce a new paradigm in recommender systems aimed at achieving universal reusability and accessibility across various datasets and tasks without manual reconfiguration.

data.source: Various datasets for testing the DTIRS framework.
